name: Vegetable Beef Soup
description: This super easy vegetable beef soup is a filling and flavorful option for lunch, dinner, or your weekly meal prep!

video.name: Vegetable Beef Soup
video.description: This super easy vegetable beef soup is a filling and flavorful option for lunch, dinner, or your weekly meal prep!

recipeIngredient: 12 oz. frozen vegetables (corn, carrots, green beans) ($1.00)

recipeInstructions.text: Dice the onion and mince the garlic. Add the onion and garlic to a soup pot along with the olive oil. Saut√© over medium heat until the onions are soft and translucent.
recipeInstructions.name: Dice the onion and mince the garlic. Add the onion and garlic to a soup pot along with the olive oil. Saut√© over medium heat until the onions are soft and translucent.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the ground beef to the pot and continue to saut√© until the ground beef is cooked through. If using a higher fat content ground beef, you can drain the excess fat, if you prefer.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the ground beef to the pot and continue to saut√© until the ground beef is cooked through. If using a higher fat content ground beef, you can drain the excess fat, if you prefer.

recipeInstructions.text: While the beef is cooking, peel and dice the russet potato into ¬Ω-inch cubes.
recipeInstructions.name: While the beef is cooking, peel and dice the russet potato into ¬Ω-inch cubes.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the cubed potatoes, diced tomatoes (with juices), Italian seasoning, pepper, beef broth, and Worcestershire sauce to the pot. Stir to combine.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the cubed potatoes, diced tomatoes (with juices), Italian seasoning, pepper, beef broth, and Worcestershire sauce to the pot. Stir to combine.

recipeInstructions.text: Turn the heat up to medium-high and allow the soup to come up to a boil. Once boiling, turn the heat down to medium-low and let the soup simmer for about 10 minutes, or until the potatoes are fork-tender.
recipeInstructions.name: Turn the heat up to medium-high and allow the soup to come up to a boil. Once boiling, turn the heat down to medium-low and let the soup simmer for about 10 minutes, or until the potatoes are fork-tender.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the frozen vegetables to the pot and allow the soup to come back up to a simmer. Simmer the vegetables in the soup for about five minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the frozen vegetables to the pot and allow the soup to come back up to a simmer. Simmer the vegetables in the soup for about five minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Finally, taste the soup and add salt to help the flavors pop. Start with ¬Ω tsp, if desired, and add more until it reaches your desired level.
recipeInstructions.name: Finally, taste the soup and add salt to help the flavors pop. Start with ¬Ω tsp, if desired, and add more until it reaches your desired level.

review.reviewBody: My 12 year old loves this soup! I am making it weekly now, and it's very easy. Sometimes I use ground turkey instead of beef.
Soup was ok but thinner than what I was hoping for and the flavor was a little bland. Not a bad freezer meal though.
In lieu of beef broth I have used V8 juice and the results were tasty wasty!
Easy to make, filling and made for good leftovers. Simple home cooking
Delicious and super easy to make!  Served it with homemade butter rolls and it was the perfect weeknight meal.

This got two thumbs up from my husband and kids (8 & 9). I always appreciate a true 30 minute meal. I made it exactly as written and sweved it with cornbread. It will definitely go in my regular rotation!
I used V8 juice instead of broth. Then seasoned to taste.
I added half Italian sausage and ground beef. Top with shredded or grated Parmesan‚Ä¶ thank me later.
I made a pot it‚Äôs looking amazing cooling down, I already know it‚Äôs so good, tasted  thanks so much for easy recipe, May God bless you

I made a double batch and swapped out black beans for ground beef in half of it to save money and increase nutrition.  Didn‚Äôt have beef ‚Äúbetter than bullion‚Äù, so I used chicken.  Swapped crushed tomatoes because that what I had.  It was incredible.  Would make great, frugal meal prep, especially if swapping beans for half the beef.
I love the idea of adding barley. Will there be enough time to cook it if added with broth?

This soup rocks. Knock out of the park, one of my fave recipes. After trying it, my boyfriend immediately declared it his favorite soup ever

I followed the recipe as closely as I could, but did make some slight substitutions based on what I had, which I will document for anyone who has not had success:
- used 1.5lbs* 80/20 fat ground beef and didn‚Äôt drain the fat
- used fire-roasted diced tomatoes
- used 16oz* frozen veggies that also included peas
- a couple of red potatoes instead of a russet
- salted the beef added the spice and black pepper during the saut√© stage (instead of adding them directly with the broth)
- added a bay leaf cause why not

*A note: using the increased amounts of beef and vegetables got this VERY close to boiling out of my 5.25qtDutch oven. It also made it more stewish.

Used up my fridge- 1/3lb organic grassfed beef, finely chopped white organic mushrooms 2oz, and a can of organic no salt kidney beans - seasoned with steak seasoning for "meat" 

Added concentrated tomato paste before broth 

Added one extra garlic clove- and only used half the bag of veggies because I had two zucchini to use 

Otherwise I followed the seasoning. Tried to get away with only three teaspoons better than bullion - but it did need four. 

Also, sprinkled in some quinoa I found at dollar store. 

I made this soup for approximately 7 dollars - but I have a feeling most of my flavor came from the splurgey worcestshire Lea and something ....

Thanks for another great recipe!

keywords: beef soup, Easy Soup, vegetable beef soup
